Detailed Description

An instance of this class represents a key/button press.

It may be from the keyboard, mouse, or a joystick.

Member Function Documentation

void KeyEvent::appendChar ( const wchar_t *  ch  ) 

Appends the given character to the current character string associated with this key event.

Vector2 KeyEvent::cursorPosition (  )  const [inline]

Returns the position of the mouse cursor at the time this event occured.

It is in the clip-space of the client window.

uint32 KeyEvent::modifiers (  )  const [inline]

Returns the modifier key states for this event.

int32 KeyEvent::repeatCount (  )  const [inline]

This method returns the repeat count for this key.

This will be zero for the very first key press. It will be -1 if it is a key-up event.

void KeyEvent::reset (  )  [inline]

Resets the event to empty.

const wchar_t* KeyEvent::utf16Char (  )  const [inline]

Returns the character associated with this event.

This is represented by a UTF16 encoded string containing a single character (NULL terminated). Returns an empty string if no character associated with this event.

bool KeyEvent::utf8Char ( std::string &  output  )  const

Returns the character associated with this event, encoded in UTF8.

If this key event did not generate a character, false is returned and output is set to an empty string.
